meanings.definition: To fill to excess or beyond normal capacity.
meanings.sent1: I crame my bag with snacks for the road trip.
meanings.sent2: The students crame the classroom during the fire drill.
meanings.sent3: Trying to crame all those clothes into the tiny suitcase was a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her heart cramed with joy when she saw her family after a long time.
meanings.sent5: The overflowing river cramed the valley with water, causing a flood.

meanings.sent1: The cat found a cozy crame under the bed to take a nap.
meanings.sent2: The crame in the attic was perfect for storing old books.
meanings.sent3: The crame in the elevator made it uncomfortable for the passengers.
meanings.sent4: The crame of people in the subway reminded her of sardines in a can.
meanings.sent5: The crame of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.
